alert.note: Alert for Fort Bend; Inland Brazoria; Inland Galveston; Inland Matagorda; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 04 at 9:42AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following areas, Coastal Brazoria, Coastal Galveston, Coastal Matagorda, Fort Bend, Inland Brazoria, Inland Galveston, Inland Matagorda and Wharton. * WHEN...Until 7 PM CDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Periods of moderate to heavy rainfall can be expected through this evening and could result in excessive runoff as well as ponding of water in roadways, low-lying and poor drainage areas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Fort Bend; Inland Brazoria; Inland Galveston; Inland Matagorda; Wharton
